name: goosey
content:
goosey adjective
(BIRD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
typical of or like a goose (= a water bird like a large duck): He voices the goose in the cartoon - the goosey way he speaks makes you smile. The peacock made a goosy noise. It was honking exactly like a goose.

goosey adjective
(NERVOUS)
US nervous or frightened, and wanting to protect yourself: He said local people were goosey about the potential ecological damage. A lot of them are goosey about discussing the war.

goosey adjective
(SKIN)
If someone's skin goes goosey, they get goosebumps (= small raised areas on their skin) because they are cold, frightened, or excited: This poem makes me breathless and goosey all over. Your skin may go blue and goosy from the cold.
